p: In summary, this study was based on a previous experiment for developing buckwheat flavonoids into a nano-drug delivery system [ 36]. We constructed a drug delivery system and investigated its characteristics in vitro and the drug delivery to animals in vivo, which provided a theoretical basis for the application of buckwheat flavonoids in clinical practice. Our results demonstrated that nanoemulsion is an effective drug delivery system that can significantly improve the antioxidant activity, in vitro release, and bioavailability compared with the corresponding drug suspension. Nanoemulsion can improve the oral absorption of drugs, promote the dissolution of the poorly soluble drugs, and enhance the bioavailability of drugs.
